RelatedSentence: Bosnia says more than a quarter of its four million people have been affected by the worst floods to hit the Balkans in living memory .
Bosnia says more than a quarter of its four million people have been affected by the worst floods to hit the Balkans in living memory .
The heaviest rainfall since records began 120 years ago caused rivers to burst their banks and triggered hundreds of landslides .

Authorities have been struggling to cope with the scale of the disaster with more than a million homes cut off from clean water supplies .

In addition , it is feared the landslides have displaced possibly thousands of unexploded land mines planted during the country 's 1992-95 war .
Serbia too has issued an urgent appeal for international help with much of the country scarred by felled trees or submerged in mud .

At least 25,000 people have been evacuated but many more are believed to have fled the flooding .

Even though the crisis has eased in some areas , a new flood wave from the swollen River Sava threatens others , notably Serbia 's largest power plant , the Nikola Tesla comples , 30 km southwest of the capital Belgrade .
